articles.title: DPRK FM Spokesman Denounces Japan's Moves for Territorial Expansion
articles.content:
DPRK FM Spokesman Denounces Japan's Moves for Territorial Expansion
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK Thursday gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA as regards Japan's open moves for territorial expansion:
					These days Japan is openly disclosing its shameless ambition for territorial expansion with absurd assertions, thus sparking off instability and escalating tension in East Asia. 
					
					Shortly ago, a UN organization on the continental shelf boundary issued a written advice disagreeing with Japan's proposal for the extension of continental shelf. However, Japan distorted it in its selfish interests and asserted that Okinodori was recognized as islet. This is an example signaling Japan's ambition for territorial expansion. 
					
					Okinodori is just a big rock situated in the waters of Pacific Ocean hundreds of kilometers away from the Japanese territory. It does not fit the category of island defined by the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea. It, therefore, can not have its own economic zone nor can be a reason for the extension of the continental shelf. 
					
					Nevertheless, Japan tried to make Okinodori an islet and put its surrounding seabed under its exclusive control. This is the sinister intention sought by brazen-faced Japan. 
					
					Japan has insisted that Tok Islets, part of the inviolable territory of Korea, belong to Japan and put an eye on even the legitimate territories of its neighboring countries. Its wild territorial ambition has now reached the phase of seeking to grab even international seabed, common wealth of mankind. 
					
					Pushing forward militarization backed by outside forces, Japan has escalated the moves to expand territory. This situation indicates the looming revival of Japanese militarism which imposed untold sufferings and disasters upon mankind, driven by the foolish dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere". 
					
					The international community should be vigilant against Japan's ambition for territorial expansion and thoroughly reject it for peace of the world and welfare of mankind.

articles.title: DPRK, Russia Sign 2013-2014 Exchange Plan
articles.content:
DPRK, Russia Sign 2013-2014 Exchange Plan
Moscow, June 27 (KCNA) -- A 2013-2014 exchange plan between the Foreign Ministries of the DPRK and Russia was signed in Moscow on June 27.
					Present there from the DPRK side were members of the delegation of the Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Kung Sok Ung, Ambassador Kim Yong Jae and officials of the DPRK embassy in Moscow and from the Russian side Vice-Minister Igor Morgulov and officials concerned of its Foreign Ministry.
					
					Kung Sok Ung and Igor Morgulov signed the plan.

articles.title: Talks Held between Party Delegations of DPRK, Sweden
articles.content:
Talks Held between Party Delegations of DPRK, Sweden
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea and a delegation of Swedish parliamentarians from the ruling coalition parties held talks in Pyongyang on Thursday.
					Present there from the DPRK side were members of the delegation led by Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the WPK Central Committee, and from the Swedish side the members of the delegation led by Johan Linander, member of the Executive Committee of the Centre Party of Sweden who is vice-chairman of the Judicial Affairs Committee of the Parliament.
					
					At the talks both sides informed each other of their party activities and exchanged views on the issue of boosting the relations between the two parties.
					
					The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Swedish Delegation Feted
articles.content:
Swedish Delegation Feted
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea on Thursday hosted a reception in honor of the visiting delegation of Swedish parliamentarians from the ruling coalition parties at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel.
					Present there on invitation were the Swedish delegation led by Johan Linander, member of the Executive Committee of the Centre Party of Sweden who is vice-chairman of the Judicial Affairs Committee of the Parliament and Anders Gunnar Backman, minister councilor of the Swedish embassy here.
					
					Secretary Kim Yong Il and officials of the WPK Central Committee were present there.
					
					Kim Yong Il and Johan Linander spoke there.

articles.title: DPRK Woman Interviewed upon Her Return Home
articles.content:
DPRK Woman Interviewed upon Her Return Home
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- DPRK woman Pak Jong Suk was interviewed by Korean and foreign reporters at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday.
					She returned home after being taken away to south Korea.
					
					Present there were media persons from the DPRK, the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, China, Russia and the U.S.
					
					Pak told about how she was taken away to south Korea.
					
					She said she was residing in Rapuk-dong No. 1, Ranam District of Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province. "I illegally crossed the border on the night of March 29, 2006 in a foolish hope of meeting my father who went to south Korea due to the A-bomb scare made by the U.S. imperialists during the Korean War and getting money from him", she said.
					
					"I was taken in by the luring tactics of south Korean Intelligence Service agents in an alien land and handed over by them according to their scenario. This was how I was taken to south Korea at around 9 a.m. of June 29 of the same year", she added.
					
					She recalled that while living in south Korea for six years she led a life little short of a miserable slave's for want of money. 
					
					Referring to the living conditions of the "defectors from the north", she said the jobs they could find at best were nothing but waste cleaning, vessel washing and servicing and other most hateful and difficult jobs. 
					
					The suicidal rate among them is five times that among other south Koreans, she said. They ardently wish to return to the DPRK, cursing corrupt south Korean society and reproaching themselves.
					
					She spoke of what she felt after coming back to the DPRK on May 25 after diverting the watch of IS agents.
					
					"A single misstep made me fall into a bottomless pitfall, leaving disgrace to my children. But my motherland injected life-giving water to me who might have become a forlorn wandering spirit," she noted. 
					
					"When I deplaned, quieting my thumping heart, I was stunned by the cordial reception given by officials concerned," Pak said, adding:
					
					"I felt at that time how affectionate and great the motherland is to me. 
					
					I would have no more to desire before I die.
					
					The dear respected Kim Jong Un did not blame me who did so many wrongs in the past but brought me under his warm care. He showed profound loving care for me.
					
					Kim Jong Un made sure that I, little different from an offender, reside in Pyongyang with my son who is a teacher of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory and daughter-in-law.
					
					I am neither a patriot nor a hero who made any tangible contribution to the country.
					
					I am an ingrate who had betrayed my motherland to seek better living while others devoted themselves to building a thriving nation, tightening their belts.
					
					I deserve punishment. But Kim Jong Un did not blame me but was so kind as to enable me to enjoy the greatest happiness. How can I forget this profound love and benevolence so long as l am alive.
					
					The world does not know such tender-hearted leader as the dear respected General Kim Jong Un.
					
					I was reborn thanks to Kim Jong Un identical to the great Generalissimos."
					
					Pak, together with the son and daughter-in-law, sang a song "My Unforgettable Path," determined to remain intensely loyal to Kim Jong Un, the tender-hearted father of the great family of the country, generation after generation.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea headed by Han U Pal, vice-chairman of its Central Committee, left here on Thursday to visit Vietnam and Laos.
					Returning home from Russia on the same day was a delegation of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea headed by Vice-Chairman of its Central Committee Kye Hui Nam.

articles.title: DPRK Footballers Down Their Hong Kong Rivals 1:0
articles.content:
DPRK Footballers Down Their Hong Kong Rivals 1:0
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The DPRK soccer team shut out its Hong Kong rival 1:0 in a preliminary match of Group F for the AFC U-22 Championship Thursday.
					The DPRK football team defeated its Thai and Lao rivals in earlier games.
					
					The DPRK team will have the fourth match with its Cambodian rival on June 30.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Coal and Ore Mines in Northern Area
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Coal and Ore Mines in Northern Area
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, made a field survey of coal and ore mines in the northern area of Korea.
					He learnt in detail about the construction of pits, coal and ore production, the modernization of transport and dressing processes and mechanization of mining operations, etc. at the Soksong Coal Mine, the Sangnong Mine and Toksong Mine.
					
					Consultative meetings of officials concerned were held at the relevant units.  The meetings took steps for giving precedence to tunneling, earth removal and construction of pits and increasing the rate of use of indigenously produced parts of machines and equipment and increasing the railway freight turnover.
					
					The meetings called upon economic officials to creatively do all work with an innovative view in line with the intention of the dear respected Kim Jong Un as required by the new century.
					
					The premier learned about the damage done by flood which hit Toksong County and took measures to ensure that the living of the people in the afflicted area returns to normal as early as possible.

articles.title: 60th Birthday of Pyongyang Circus Marked
articles.content:
Pyongyang Circus Greets Its 60th Birthday
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- A congratulatory message of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea was conveyed on Wednesday to the Pyongyang Circus on its 60th birthday.
					The Circus was founded on June 10, Juche 41 (1952) when the country was in the thick of the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					Since its debut that year, it created more than 1 000 pieces of physical acrobatics, juggleries, interludes and animal stunts.
					
					The circus introduced ice acrobatics and synchronized swimming, putting the country's acrobatics on a higher level. It has made performance tours of many countries.
					
					It took titles 30 odd times at the world acrobatic championships and international acrobatic festivals, including Monte Carlo International Circus Festival, winning gold and special prizes and stunt prizes.
					
					The grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" and the grand magic offer a glimpse of the development of the circus.
					
					The circus is proud of many People's Artists and Merited Artists as well as young talents. It has Pyongyang Acrobatic School and the Pyongyang Circus Theater.
					
					Typical of its works are "Flying Girls" and "Diverse Flight."
					
					The circus was awarded Order of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: 4th Commodity Exhibition Under Way in Pyongyang
articles.content:
4th Commodity Exhibition under Way in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The 4th Commodity Exhibition is now going on at Pyongyang Department Store No.1.
					On display there are more than 3.3 million items of some 1 500 varieties, including foodstuffs, textile goods and daily necessities.
					
					400 kinds of footwear exhibits are attracting attention of visitors.
					
					So Il Dong, section chief of the Ministry of Light Industry, told KCNA that local shoes factories would develop more kinds of footwear products to satisfy growing demand.
					
					The Samilpho Specialties Factory put on display scores of kinds of new products, including Lentinus edodes, dried bracken, mung-bean powder for cooking pancake.
					
					The exhibits presented by the Sonhung Foodstuff Factory, too, are catching visitors' eyes.

articles.title: DPRK Takes Anti-flood Measures
articles.content:
DPRK Takes Anti-flood Measures
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- July and August are usually the rainy season in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					According to the Hydro-meteorological Service, it is expected to have much rain accompanied by downpour in the country from early July.
					
					In this regard, measures are being taken in all economic sectors to prevent flood damage.
					
					Coal mines and power plants are finding out and remedying dangerous spots in coal yards and conveying systems, while clearing out ditches and keeping draining pumps and electric motors ready to operate.
					
					In the railway sector including the Hamhung, Chongjin and Kaechon railway bureaus, efforts are concentrated on reinforcing railway lines and structures and building retaining walls in grade sections.
					
					In the fields of construction and light industry, too, necessary steps are taken to prevent any possible damage from rainy wind and damp.
					
					In the field of agriculture, tens of reservoir dams have been reinforced and irrigation canals readjusted and improved.
					
					Meanwhile, urban administration units in provinces, cities and counties are directing efforts to dredging river-beds, improving embankments and readjusting floodgates and dams.
					
					They are also taking steps to prevent sources of water supply from being submerged.

articles.title: Underground Roadway Built in Changjon Street
articles.content:
Underground Roadway Built in Changjon Street
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- There is an underground roadway in modernly-built Changjon Street in the heart of Pyongyang.
					The roadway has sidewalks and more than ten stalls on either side.
					
					A round-shaped flowerbed stands in the middle of the roadway. Its ceiling is installed with various shapes of lamps and lighting apparatuses.
					
					The roadway also has entrances to Unjong Teahouse, Songyong Restaurant and Haemaji Restaurant built on the ground.
					
					There are stairways down to the underground roadway in the park in the street.
					
					Pedestrians choose this roadway to cross the road in these hot days.

articles.title: Changjon Street in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Changjon Street in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Changjon Street of modern style has appeared in the heart of Pyongyang, the capital city of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					The street is adjacent to Mansu Hill where statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il stand.
					
					It boasts of high-rises, the People's Theater, boulevards, service buildings and greenbelt.
					
					All of the buildings were tiled or covered with glasses.
					
					Each dwelling house is much more spacious than the previous one, with its walls and ceilings delicately plastered. Everything in the house is flawless. The fashionable houses were all offered to citizens free of charge.
					
					Pyongyang Changjon Primary School, Kyongsang Kindergarten and Kyongsang Nursery, newly built in sunny spots, go well with the apartment buildings in the street. Among attractions are Songyong Restaurant and Unjong Teahouse. 
					
					Ordinary working people are leading an enjoyable life in this street associated with deep love of leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un for the people.

articles.title: U.S. Can Never Cover up Its True Colors as Provocateur of Korean War (2)
articles.content:
U.S. Can Never Cover up Its True Colors as Provocateur of Korean War (2)
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The U.S. was keenly interested in the Korean War also because of its serious economic crisis at that time.
					Economic depression started in the light industrial field at the end of 1948 and then caused a chain reaction in the heavy industry. It rapidly hit iron and steel industry in March 1949. As a result, about 4 600 companies went bankrupt in the first half of that year, causing a huge surplus work force. The number of the full unemployed was expected to increase to 13 million within 1950. The profits of monopolies drastically dropped to 28.4 billion U.S. dollars in March 1949 from 36.6 billion U.S. dollars in September 1948.
					
					The monopoly tycoons of the U.S. urged the ruling quarters of the administration to start a new war, expecting the government to make preparations for giving a fresh strong shot in the arm of economy.
					
					"War for prosperity!" was a call of U.S. monopoly capitalists who were struggling to rid of the crisis caused by over-production.
					
					The reactionary government speaking for the interests of the U.S. billionaires finally put spurs to the war preparations, stepping up militarization of economy and arms race.
					
					Arms race unprecedented in peacetime in the U.S. history was kicked off with 1948 when economic crisis started as a momentum and the horror of economic crisis reached at its height in 1950. The Korean War broke out that year against this background. 
					
					Commenting on this, Japanese book "Korean War" said that "Korean War was a way-out of economic crisis that faced the U.S."
					
					The U.S. ignited the Korean War also because the puppet regimes in Asia were on the verge of collapse.
					
					The south Korean puppet regime of Syngman Rhee faced a serious ruling crisis after its shameful defeat at the puppet National Assembly election on May 30, 1950.
					
					The Rhee clique held just 47 seats out of 210 seats in the NA while the "faction calling for negotiations with the north" dominated it.
					
					If a "presidential election" was held under that balance of forces in the NA, it was very likely that a "candidate from the middle faction" would be elected.
					
					As an American historian commented, a war was "the last hope" of the Rhee clique to survive under that situation and it was to ignite a fratricidal war as soon as possible.
					
					Traitor Syngman Rhee sent Jang Myon to Washington to inform it of the fact that the "government" might collapse around June 10 - 13 and "asked for prompt U.S. assistance" to help him weather the crisis.
					
					Upon receiving an urgent message from Rhee, Truman had to prevent the collapse of the puppet government in south Korea as there was no other way for him but to "support him" and had no option but to ignite the projected war as early as possible, as he confessed. 
					
					Another reason for the U.S to decide to go to war was the information that the Chinese people were planning to liberate Taiwan in summer of 1950.
					
					According to what was confessed by Mun Hak Bong, former advisor to the CIC and political advisor to Syngman Rhee, the U.S. received information that the Chinese people would conduct an operation for liberating Taiwan in July, at the latest, and came to make a decision to take an initiative. This prompted the U.S. to advance the date of the start of the Korean War.

articles.title: Criminal Deeds Done by S. Korea's Syngman Rhee Clique to Provoke Korean War
articles.content:
Criminal Deeds Done by S. Korea's Syngman Rhee Clique to Provoke Korean War
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists' scheme to provoke a war in the Korean Peninsula after the Second World War was rapidly carried into practice by south Korea's Syngman Rhee puppet clique.
					The clique trampled on the unanimous desire of the Korean people for the peaceful reunification of the country, trying to unleash the war.
					
					It drastically increased armaments. It built more infantry regiments, armored regiment and artillery and engineer battalions under the instructions and aid of the U.S. imperialists and, on their basis, formed five brigades and 15 regiments till July 1948.
					
					The Syngman Rhee clique declared the formation of the south Korean army on September 1, 1948 and set up the ground, naval and air force headquarters at the reformed Ministry of Defense.
					
					Pursuant to the demand of the U.S. imperialists, the clique bolstered up the puppet armed forces and, as a result, the south Korean troops totaled to 160 000 including over 50 000 combat policemen.
					
					Traitor Syngman Rhee's attempt for north expedition reached the extremes in the autumn of 1949 after the U.S. imperialists worked out a plan on attack on the north.
					
					Vouching that they could occupy Pyongyang within three days, the Rhee clique claimed that Korea should be reunified by force and that the south Korean army was ready for attacking north Korea.
					
					Such facts evidently show who ran amuck to provoke the Korean War, opposing to the peaceful reunification of Korea.

articles.title: Seoul Liberation Operation
articles.content:
Victorious Seoul Liberation Operation
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- On June 25, 1950, the U.S. imperialists started the Korean War by instigating the Syngman Rhee clique of south Korea to make an attack on the Democratic People's Republic of Korea all along the 38th parallel.
					Just after the outbreak of the war, President Kim Il Sung issued an order to stop the enemies' attack and promptly go over to counteroffensive.
					
					He designated the western front as a target of main strike by the Korean People's Army, and worked out an operation plan to liberate Seoul City, suggesting that the attack on it be made on June 28 morning.
					
					Under his instructions, KPA combined units smashed the enemies in Mts. Tobong and Pulam to occupy the areas of Hwagye-dong and Mt. Ponghwa.
					
					A KPA unit, made up of five tanks and motorized infantry sub-unit, started action on the afternoon of June 27 to break into Kyongbok Palace in the enemy's rear, at 04:30 on June 28. The 4th Infantry Division of the KPA advanced into the city, destroying the defenses of six puppet army divisions and military police, including the metropolitan division.
					
					KPA soldiers took control of radio station, Sodaemun Prison, army headquarters, military police command, central telegraph office, Kyongmudae and others in the city.
					
					A DPRK flag was hoisted on the roof of the "Capital Building", with Seoul City completely liberated at 11:30 on June 28.
					
					The liberation of Seoul dealt a heavy blow to the U.S. aggressors who made light of the Korean people.
					
					The victory was attributable entirely to Kim Il Sung's distinguished commanding art.

articles.title: Japan Used as U.S. Military Supply Base for Korean War
articles.content:
Japan Used as U.S. Military Supply Base for Korean War
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists used Japan to make preparations for the Korean War (1950-1953).
					Japanese war criminals began to be released in December 1948 and the ordinance on purging those criminals from public life became invalid.
					
					A number of fascist organizations were revived in Japan at the U.S. instigation, and they went so far as to call for the revival of the Japanese Empire by annexing Korea and Taiwan to Japan under the slogan of the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere".
					
					The policy on the Far East Arsenal began to be carried into effect in Japan in the year 1949. Machinery and chemical factories had been turned into to munitions factories from early 1950 on the instruction of the MacArthur's Command.
					
					In April 1950, all shipyards in Japan launched transforming U.S. tank carriers into troop carriers.
					
					Runways for large bombers were constructed across Japan from Hokkaido to Kyusu.
					
					Meanwhile, a wholesale crackdown on Japan-resident Koreans, their democratic organizations and Japan's democratic forces was committed in Japan as part of the preparations for the Korean War.
					
					All these facts show that Japan actually joined the United States in preparing the Korean War.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Actions against Forces Opposed to June 15 Joint Declaration
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Actions against Forces Opposed to June 15 Joint Declaration
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Korean nation can never pardon the moves of the forces opposed to the June 15 joint declaration as they stand in the way of achieving the reconciliation and unity between the north and the south, disturb peace and bring the danger of a war, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a bylined article.
					It goes on:
					
					The present ruling forces of south Korea are dead-set against the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, seeking only confrontation and war, not national reconciliation and unity.
					
					Once, they, taking hands of the DPRK, supported the joint declaration and tried hard to create impression that any problem would be solved if the DPRK discussed it with them. Nevertheless, they have frantically escalated confrontation with compatriots, while working hard to fabricate "law on human rights in the north", and kicked off a ruckus for "eliminating forces following the north".
					
					This suggests that if they stayed in power, they would totally block the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration. 
					
					It is needless to say that if the confrontation-minded maniacs are allowed to stay in power, the aggravated inter-Korean relations will never be mended nor peace be achieved and the progressive pro-reform forces in south Korea would be mercilessly stamped out.
					
					It is the only way for saving the inter-Korean relations from catastrophe to respect and implement the above-said declarations.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japan of Its Participation in Korean War
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japan of Its Participation in Korean War
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries provided the U.S. with huge human and material resources after taking part in the Korean War ignited by it.
					Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a bylined article.
					
					Japan earned an ill fame as a war servant of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					At the U.S. instruction, the Japanese authorities dispatched the first batch of 200 generals and officers of the former Imperial Japanese Army right after the outbreak of the Korean War. Donning uniforms of the south Korean puppet forces, they performed their missions as "advisors" at staffs and other posts.
					
					Many Japanese troops were hurled into the Korean front later.
					
					Among them were members of the Yamasaki institution under the "UN Command" made up of intelligence officers familiar with Korea's topography. At the direct instruction of the U.S. imperialists, they worked out maps and catalogues giving detailed information about not only military strongholds, harbors, factories and hospitals but shapes of facilities and power network in the DPRK.
					
					50 Japanese warships and 2 000 seamen were directly involved in the Inchon-landing operation.
					
					Japan dispatched its pilots to the Korean front. They joined in the U.S. transport of war materiel and air raids in the entire period of the war.
					
					Japanese "technical" personnel provided strong backing to the U.S. military actions in such areas as railway transport of "UN forces," communications, printing, harbors and power stations.
					
					Japan offered its nurses to U.S. forces' field hospitals under the name of a "rescue team". Virtually, they served as comfort women for U.S. forces.
					
					It was none other than the Japanese warmongers who fully supported the U.S. imperialists in their cruel germ warfare and took the lead in it.
					
					This is just part of evidence proving Japan's participation in the Korean War, the article notes, warning that in case the Japanese warlike forces zealously partake of the U.S. imperialists' moves to provoke a war against the DPRK, they will not be able to go scot-free quite contrary to what happened in the 1950s.

articles.title: Probability of "Cheonan" Warship Sinking by Torpedo Is Zero Pct.: U.S.-Residing Korean Scientists
articles.content:
Probability of "Cheonan" Warship Sinking by Torpedo Is Zero Pct.: U.S.-Residing Korean Scientists
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Korean scientists in the U.S. insisted that the probability of south Korean warship "Cheonan's" sinking by the DPRK's torpedo attack is zero per cent, according to the south Korean newspaper Hangyore on June 23.
					Kim Kwang Sop, doctor of chemical engineering at a university in the U.S., in his paper said that the joint team for investigation into the case of the "Cheonan" warship sinking made erroneous analysis of aluminum adsorptive and failed to prove the story about the warship sinking by "torpedo No. 1".
					
					Presenting his paper to the south Korean Ministry of Defense, he demanded it correct the story concerning "torpedo No.1."
					
					An Su Myong, doctor of electric and computer engineering and submarine specialist of Berkeley University in the U.S., expressed his doubt about the result produced by the joint investigation team.
					
					He said the team drew a conclusion that the warship was sent to the bottom being torpedoed by the north's submarine boat and accused the team of having failed to prove its possibility.
					
					If a mine is not to blame for the explosion, the case is same with torpedo in light of the speed of water stream, tide difference, the depth of water, fog and other conditions in the waters near Paekryong Island at that time, he said, adding:
					
					The joint investigation team said the warship was cut into two pieces by shock generated by the explosion of torpedo under the warship.
					
					The "Cheonan" warship was 10 meters in width and torpedo speed is 15.3 meters per second.
					
					This means that torpedo can stay under the warship only for about 0.6 seconds.
					
					If the investigation team's assertion is true, the torpedo might have exploded at that very interval at the exact point where the team said the incident happened.
					
					In view of the actual conditions of the West Sea of Korea, the attack capacity of submarine boat and torpedo's sound signal processing for detecting targets, the probability can be considered close to 0.0000001 per cent.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Introduced in Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Introduced in Nepal
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Nepali newspaper Arpan carried the detailed gist of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Comrade Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and People" on June 22. 
					The work, published on April 20, 2012, deals with the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					It indicates tasks for firmly upholding and preserving their idea and exploits and glorifying them forever.
					
					The Nepali paper Charcha on June 18 carried the detailed gist of the congratulatory speech made by Kim Jong Un at a joint national meeting of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) organizations in celebration of its 66th birthday.
					
					Kim Jong Un in his speech on June 6, 2012 expressed his steadfast will to invariably carry forward the noble outlook of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on future and the rising generation.
					
					He also indicated tasks and ways for bringing up the KCU members to be reserves, knowledgeable, virtuous and healthy, who will be responsible for the future destiny of the country and the nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Posted on Internet Website of Belarusian Political Party
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Posted on Internet Website of Belarusian Political Party
Pyongyang, June 28, (KCNA) -- The Communist Workers' Party of Belarus posted on its internet website on June 19 the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche"
					The work, published on April 6, 2012, clarifies the idea that it is a principled requirement for the victorious advance of the Korean revolution to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					
					Also posted on the website were Kim Jong Un's works "Let's Dynamically Struggle for a Final Victory, Holding Aloft the Banner of Songun" and "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation". The works were made public in April.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Foreign Newspapers
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					The Bangladeshi paper Blits on June 6 gave a detailed account of the fact that the single-minded unity of the whole party and all the people has been further consolidated in the DPRK under his wise leadership.
					
					He is a paragon of great statesmen and people's leaders who devoted himself to the people with absolute love for and trust in them, the paper noted.
					
					The Indian paper Defence and Humanity on June 18 said that he performed undying feats in party building while leading the WPK for decades.
					
					The Mongolian paper Mongolyn Unen on the same day carried a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il and an article praising him for his feats in party building.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats in Party Building Introduced by Ethiopian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats in Party Building Introduced by Ethiopian Organization
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea published bulletin No. 38 to mark the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					The bulletin said in an article titled "Kim Jong Il's Exploits in Developing WPK" that he built the WPK as an invincible revolutionary party and worked heart and soul to enable the people to lead an affluent and highly civilized life.
					
					Though Kim Jong Il passed away, the undying feats performed by him in party building will shine forever, stressed the bulletin.

articles.title: Italian Organization Renamed Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Study Group
articles.content:
Italian Organization Renamed Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Study Group
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Songun Idea in Fermo of Italy was renamed the Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Study Group on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					A renaming ceremony took place in Fermo City on June 19.
					
					Present there were the chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Songun Idea in Fermo of Italy, the secretary of the Fermo City Committee of the Communist Party of Italy, the chief of the Fermo City Trade Unions and other people.
					
					A letter to the dear respected Kim Jong Un was adopted at the ceremony.

articles.title: Russian Paper Criticizes U.S., South Korean Military Provocations against DPRK
articles.content:
Russian Paper Criticizes U.S., South Korean Military Provocations against DPRK
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Russian paper Nezabisimaya Gazetta carried an article accusing the U.S. and south Korea of their military provocations against the DPRK on June 26.
					They fired live shells at the flag of the DPRK, producing a tragicomedy, the paper said, and went on:
					
					This provocation triggered off anger and criticism from Pyongyang.
					
					This happened during a drill staged to mark the 62nd anniversary of the Korean War started by them.
					
					Washington and Seoul "commemorated" the day of the Korean people's tragedy with such provocation.
					
					That day the U.S. forces and the south Korean army staged a joint exercise by mobilizing tanks, fighters and helicopters.
					
					Pyongyang termed it a hostile action betraying the U.S. intention to put the whole of Korea under its control.
					
					In the final analysis, the U.S. and south Korea escalated tensions.
					
					This cannot but make Russia and China uneasy, a researcher of the Center for Korean Studies of the Institute of the Far East of the Russian Academy of Sciences commented when interviewed by the paper.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korean Moves against DPRK Condemned
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean Moves against DPRK Condemned
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Foreign political parties and organizations condemned the U.S. and south Korean authorities for their recent frantic moves against the DPRK.
					The Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party and the South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with Korean People in a joint statement on June 14 branded the south Korean Lee Myung Bak regime's reckless acts of defaming the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union and hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK as an unpardonable thrice-cursed crimes.
					
					The Slovenia-DPRK Friendship Association in a statement on June 13 condemned the Lee group for scheming to create an atmosphere of sanctions and pressure upon the DPRK, while threatening it with sustained provocations.
					
					The France-Korea Friendship Association in a statement on June 19 said that the danger of armed conflicts and war is increasing in the Korean Peninsula due to the moves of the U.S. for a war.
					
					It demanded an immediate stop to the U.S. provocative moves for beefing up armed forces which spark off an arms race in Northeast Asia and pose a grave threat to the world peace and security.

articles.title: U.S. Nuclear-powered Carrier George Washington Enters Pusan Port
articles.content:
U.S. Nuclear-powered Carrier George Washington Enters Pusan Port
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The nuclear-powered carrier George Washington of the U.S. forces entered the Pusan Port of south Korea on Wednesday, according to south Korean Yonhap News. 
					Also entering were two missile cruisers and a guided missile destroyer belonging to the carrier flotilla.

articles.title: Anti-Regime Actions Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-Regime Actions Called for in S. Korea
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea made public an appeal to the progressive forces on June 25, calling on them to rise in united actions against Lee Myung Bak, Park Geun Hye and the "Saenuri Party." 
					Referring to the fact that the "government" authorities are going all the more reckless in their extreme hostile actions against compatriots, the appeal said that the noisy "north wind" campaign again kicked off by them in the run-up to the "presidential" election is the last-ditch efforts of the conservative forces to tide over their crisis.
					
					"A witch-hunt campaign against the forces following the north" is going on in south Korea and there is a whirlwind for "verifying ideology" which can be seen only on the eve of a war and the movement of the progressives for independence and peaceful reunification is being wrongly accused, the appeal deplored, and continued:
					
					It called on the progressives to frustrate the authorities' suppression of them under the pretext of security and punish the present "government" through united actions.
					
					It also appealed to the progressive forces to take the lead in the struggle against Lee Myung Bak, Park Geun Hye and the "Saenuri Party".

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Accused of Blocking National Concord
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Accused of Blocking National Concord
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Sang Gun, permanent representative of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, on June 14 scathingly criticized traitor Lee Myung Bak for blocking national reconciliation, unity and reunification.
					He said, "Lee Myung Bak blocked the road of national concord, the road of peace. He is ignorant of even the word of national concord."
					
					The reunion of separated families and relatives which had taken place several times every year since the publication of the June 15 joint declaration was held only twice under the present regime, he deplored. 
					
					Various public circles demanded on many occasions the drop of the hostile policy going against the trend of the times and restoration of non-governmental exchange, but Lee Myung Bak lent no ear to the demand, he said. On the contrary, Lee declared the "May 24 measures," totally suspending not only the exchange between the authorities but almost all the non-governmental exchanges.
					
					"For the last three years and four months when I held the post of permanent representative of the committee, I have never been allowed to hold even a single joint event of the nation, nor have I got a permission to conduct even a single legitimate exchange and cooperation", he noted.
					
					He branded such opposition to peaceful reunification as an action against history and ethics.
					
					"No nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars," in particular, stemmed from half-baked capitalist philosophy, he said, deploring, "We have seen a politician who reads out speeches written by others, a politician with half-baked philosophy. It is misfortune of history."
					
					South Korea should produce a figure and political forces with a right philosophy and politics on national concord and peace, he urged.

articles.title: S. Korean Construction Unionists Start General Strike
articles.content:
S. Korean Construction Unionists Start General Strike
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Construction Trade Union under the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions started a general strike Wednesday, according to south Korean KBS.
					The strike started simultaneously by all branches across south Korea including Ulsan.
					
					The trade unions made demands for payment of wages unpaid, steps for prevention of industrial disasters and provision of the right to existence of workers in the construction field.

articles.title: Earthquake Damage Expands in China
articles.content:
Earthquake Damage Expands in China
Beijing, June 27 (KCNA) -- The damage done by the earthquake that struck the border between Sichuan and Yunnan provinces is expanding. 
					As of June 25, the quake left four people dead and 152 others wounded. 
					
					It destroyed houses for more than 3 800 families. It forced more than 22,000 people to make an emergency evacuation.
					
					The number of victims totals 71 000.
					
					Relief measures are now being taken on the spot.

articles.title: Worsening Economic Situation of U.S.
articles.content:
Worsening Economic Situation of U.S.
Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The economic situation in the U.S. is getting from bad to worse.
					U.S. President Obama referred to the domestic economic performance. He talked nonsense that non-governmental fields are doing well and new jobs are being created only to touch off public criticism that his remarks were contrary to the American public feelings.
					
					Recent facts prove that this criticism was well grounded.
					
					An economic organization of the U.S. on June 15 noted that the consumer credit index which shows the viewpoints of the citizens on the prevailing economic situation slipped by 5.2 over the index in May, an all time low since December of last year.
					
					According to the recent nationwide opinion poll, 75 pct of respondents expressed concern that the U.S. might find itself in another economic stagnation.
					
					Unemployment and poverty in U.S. society are something like an incurable cancer steadily deteriorating its economic performance.
					
					The number of the jobless has reached 12.7 million as of May, or an increase of 200 000 over April.
					
					Of them, 5.1 million are those who remained jobless for a long period.
					
					387 000 more people were registered as jobless in the U.S. for a week ending June 16.
					
					The number of the poor has swelled in the U.S. since Obama took office.
					
					The number of the poor was more than 37 million in 2007 but it increased to 49.1 million in 2011.
					
					About 20 million of them are the extremely poor people.
					
					International Herald Tribune on September 15, 2011 said that poverty in the U.S. was the worst in 52 years since the first survey was made on the poor in the U.S. 
					
					Meantime, spiraling commodity prices are making Americans' living harder.
					
					The U.S. budget and trade deficits sharply increased, causing its state debt to dramatically swell.
					
					The chairman of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System of the U.S. deplored at the hearing of the Budget Committee of the U.S.  House of Representatives held in February that its debt reached 15 trillion U.S. dollars, terming it a serious problem.
					
					All facts go to clearly prove that it is quite impossible for the U.S. to recover its economy and its future remains very gloomy.

articles.title: IRGC Ready to Give Crushing Response to Enemies: Commander
articles.content:
IRGC Ready to Give Crushing Response to Enemies: Commander
Tehran, June 27 (KCNA) -- Commander of Aerospace Department of the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps of Iran (IRGC) Brigadier General Amir-Ali Hajizadeh said that Iran is not willing to wage war against other countries but is fully ready to give a crushing response to enemies, the Press TV reported.
					He made the remarks in a meeting with foreign military attaches residing in Iran on Sunday.
					
					The commander said pressures and threat pursued by the West will backfire and will lead to more preparedness and higher capabilities of the Iranian people. 
					
					All plots against Iran are doomed to failure, he said.

articles.title: MINREX condena ambicion expansionista de Japon
articles.content:
MINREX condena ambicion expansionista de Japon
Pyongyang, 28 de junio (ACNC) -- En relacion con que se torna cada dia mas abierto el expansionismo territorial de Japon, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea contesto el dia 28 a la ACNC como sigue:
					Ultimamente, Japon desestabiliza a Asia oriental y agrava la tension en esta region exponiendo en todas partes su absurda, cinica y obstinada ambicion de expandir el territorio.
					
					Por ejemplo, al tergiversar a su conveniencia la nota de recomienda publicada por el Comite de Demarcacion de Plataformas Continentales de la ONU desaprobando la propuesta de Japon de expandir su plataforma continental, ese pais isleno insistio en que Okinodori fue reconocido como su islote.
					
					Okinodori no pasa de ser una roca del Mar Pacifico situada a centenares de kilometros del territorio japones, por lo tanto, no pertenece a la categoria de islas establecida por la convencion de ley maritima de la ONU ni puede tener su propia zona maritima economica ni ser fundamento de la extension de plataforma continental.
					
					Sin embargo, Japon se obstina en su descarada ambicion de convertirlo en un islote y apoderarse de las zonas submarinas perifericas.
					
					Es decir, el expansionismo territorial de Japon, que insiste en su soberania sobre el islote Tok, sagrado territorio de la nacion coreana, y esta antojado de las tierras legitimas de otros paises vecinos, llego a tal grado que trata ahora de despojar hasta el fondo del mar internacional, patrimonio comun de la humanidad.
					
					El hecho de que Japon amplia de manera escalonada sus acciones expansionistas dando acicates a su militarizacion bajo el abrigo de las fuerzas foraneas, prenuncia el renacimiento del militarismo japones que impuso a la humanidad indecibles sufrimientos y desastres para realizar su ilusion agresiva de la "esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia Oriental".
					
					Por la paz mundial y el bienestar de la humanidad, la sociedad internacional tendra que prestar debida atencion y rechazar categoricamente la ambicion expansionista de Japon.

articles.title: Pak Jong Suk se entrevista con periodistas
articles.content:
Pak Jong Suk se entrevista con periodistas
Pyongyang, 28 de junio (ACNC) -- Volvio a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea la ciudadana Pak Jong Suk quien habia sido raptada y llevada al Sur de Corea.
					Ella concedio el dia 28 una rueda de prensa en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo.
					
					A la ocasion asistieron los periodistas de la rama de prensa e informacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon) y de China, Rusia y Estados Unidos.
					
					Ante todo, Pak hablo de como fue raptada y llevada luego al territorio surcoreano.
					
					Por la noche del 29 de marzo de 2006, cuando residia en el barrio no.1 de Rabuk del municipio Ranam de la ciudad de Chongjin de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, ella salio ilegalmente del pais para pedir el dinero a su padre quien se habia trasladado al Sur de Corea durante la pasada guerra coreana (1950-1953) intimidado por la amenaza de EE.UU. con usar bombas atomicas contra la RPDC.
					
					En la tierra foranea cayo en la trampa que le hicieron los agentes del Servicio de Inteligencia del Sur de Corea que la trasladaron de un lugar a otro por turno.
					
					A eso de las 9 de la manana del 29 de junio de ese ano, llego al suelo surcoreano siendo enganada.
					
					Seguidamente, Pak conto a los periodistas los episodios tragicos ocurridos en los 6 anos de su vida casi de esclava que llevo en el Sur de Corea.
					
					Al referirse a la situacion de los "fugitivos norcoreanos" que viven ahora en suelo surcoreano, comento que ellos son sometidos a los trabajos mas vulgares y duros como limpieza de basuras, fregadura y servidumbre y el porcentaje de suicidio entre ellos es el quintuplo al de los surcoreanos.
					
					Actualmente, ellos anhelan regresar a la RPDC maldiciendo la corrupta sociedad surcoreana y arrepintiendose de su salida ilegal, acoto. 
					
					Expreso su impresion de haberse acogido el pasado 25 de mayo en el regazo de la RPDC, luego de despistar a los agentes del Servicio de Inteligencia, como sigue:
					
					La patria madre me hizo renacer liberandome del abismo de muerte.
					
					Me quede atonita cuando en el aeropuerto me acogian con alegria los funcionarios interesados.
					
					No puedo olvidar nunca la generosa patria.
					
					El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un me abrazo en su  regazo sin reprochar mi pasado lleno de crimenes y me dispenso inmensas benevolencias.
					
					Me hizo vivir en Pyongyang con mi hijo quien trabaja como profesor del Conservatorio Kim Won Gyun de Pyongyang. 
					
					No soy patriota ni heroina.
					
					Por el contrario, soy criminal que abandono la patria para fines egoistas cuando otros dedicaban su sudor y hasta sangre a la construccion de un Estado prospero resistiendo la carestia.
					
					Sin embargo, en vez de reprocharme, nuestro Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, sin par en este mundo, ha sido tan generoso conmigo y tomo las medidas necesarias para asegurar mi vida feliz.
					
					No puedo olvidar nunca ese favor tan grande.
					
					Naci de nuevo gracias al Maximo Dirigente, identico a los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il.
					
					Al final, Pak entono la cancion "Mi camino inolvidable" con su hijo y nuera expresando su deseo de apoyar con fidelidad de generacion en generacion al Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, padre benevolo de todo el pais que forma una gran familia.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim recorre minas en zona septentrional de Corea
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim recorre minas en zona septentrional de Corea
Pyongyang, 28 de junio (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, averiguo en el terreno el estado de produccion en las minas de la zona norte del pais.
					Se informo en detalles del estado de construccion de galerias, produccion de carbon y minerales, modernizacion de los sistemas de transporte y enriquecimiento de minerales y mecanizacion de la excavacion y otras faenas de la mina carbonifera de Soksong y las minas de Sangnong y Toksong.
					
					Se convocaron en dichas unidades las reuniones consultivas de los funcionarios correespondientes.
					
					Se tomaron en las ocasiones las medidas para anteponer la perforacion, la evacuacion de esteril y la construccion de galerias e incrementar el porcentaje de productos nacionales en las piezas de maquinaria y la capacidad de transporte ferroviario de cargas.
					
					Se resalto la importancia de exigir a los funcionarios de la rama economica cumplir de modo creativo todos los trabajos conforme a la demanda del nuevo siglo y con la vision innovadora como desea el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un.
					
					Por otra parte, el premier estudio la magnitud de los danos que sufrio el distrito de Toksong debido a las inundaciones y asigno las tareas para estabilizar cuanto antes la vida de los damnificados.

articles.title: Renovada avenida Changjon
articles.content:
Renovada avenida Changjon
Pyongyang, 28 de junio (ACNC) -- La avenida Changjon fue reconstruida como la ideal del pueblo en la capitalina zona de Mansudae.
					Desde la colina Mansu, donde estan erguidas las estatuas de bronce de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il, se ve todo el paisaje de la avenida.
					
					Las viviendas de altos pisos, el Teatro del Pueblo construido majestuosamente, las carreteras anchas, los edificios de servicios levantados a largo de la avenida, los arboles con hojas verdes, etc. todo parece un cuadro hermoso.
					
					Los edificios de forma aerodinamica ubicados armoniosamente fueron construidos con los azulejos de buena calidad y color claro y los vidrios modernos.
					
					Los techos tambien fueron condecorados magnificamente.
					
					Estan colocados los modernos ascensores con poco ruido y sin vibracion.
					
					Las viviendas de cada apartamento fueron acondicionadas en el alto nivel.
					
					Las habitaciones son mas anchas que antes y las paredes y techos fueron bien adornados.
					
					El Estado ofrecio gratis al pueblo tales viviendas modernas.
					
					La Escuela Primaria de Changjon, el Jardin Infantil y la Casa Cuna, de Kyongsang, fueron levantados en orden en una solana.
					
					Las redes de servicio publico incluyendo el Restaurante Combinado Songyong y la Cafeteria Unjong esperan a los huespedes.
					
					En esta avenida donde se hizo realidad el amor por el pueblo de los grandes hombres sin pares, viven los habitantes trabajadores comunes disfrutando de los beneficios socialistas.

articles.title: EE.UU no puede ocultar su identidad de provocador de guerra (2)
articles.content:
EE.UU no puede ocultar su identidad de provocador de guerra (2)
Pyongyang, 28 de junio (ACNC) --
					
					Guerra coreana y crisis economica de Estados Unidos
						
					
					Otro interes perentorio de EE.UU. en la provocacion de la guerra coreana estaba relacionado con la severa crisis economica de aquel entonces.
					
					La crisis ocurrida a finales de 1948 desde en la rama de la industria ligera reacciono en cadena paulatinamente en la industria pesada. En marzo de 1949, se extendio tambien a la rama de materiales de hierro y acero, razon por la cual solo en el primer semestre fueron arruinadas casi 4 mil 600 companias.
					
					Se previo que debido a la mano de obra sobrante, se aumentarian dentro de 1950 en 13 millones de desempleados y la ganancia de los monopolios disminuyo bruscamente en marzo de 1949 en 28 mil 400 millones de USD, frente a 36 mil 600 millones de USD en septiembre de 1948.
					
					Depositando al gobierno la esperanza de que revitalizara la economia, los monopolios demandaron a los gobernantes provocar la nueva guerra.
					
					"!Guerra garantiza la prosperidad!", era la demanda de los monopolios en la crisis causada por la superproduccion.
					
					El gobierno reaccionario que representaba el interes de los multimillonarios estadounidenses recurrio con frenesi a la militarizacion de la economia y la carrera armamentista, dando acicate a los preparativos de guerra.
					
					Por tal motivo, desde 1948 en que se inicio la crisis economica, empezo el aumento de gastos militares nunca visto en la historia del pais americano de la epoca pacifica y en 1950 cuando llego al extremo el temor causado por la crisis economica se desencadeno la guerra coreana
					
					El libro japones "Guerra coreana" senala que la guerra coreana fue la medida para salir de la crisis economica con que se enfrenta EE.UU.
						
					
					Guerra coreana y poderes titeres de Asia
						
					
					La provocacion de guerra coreana esta relacionada tambien con la crisis de derrumbe de los gobiernos titeres en Asia.
					
					La derrota en las elecciones parlamentarias titeres efectuadas el 30 de mayo de 1950 en el Sur de Corea echo a la crisis el poder de Syngman Rhee.
					
					La banda de Syngman Rhee obtuvo solo 47 de los 210 escanos y prevalecieron quienes se llamaban como "grupo insistente en las negociaciones Sur-Norte". Si se realizaban las "elecciones presidenciales" en la nueva "Asamblea Nacional", seria seleccionado el "delegado del grupo neutral".
					
					Como afirmo un historico estadounidense, para la banda de Syngman Rhee, la "ultima esperanza para sobrevivir" fue provocar lo mas pronto posible la guerra.
					
					El traidor envio rapidamente Jang Myon a Washington para "demandar a EE.UU. la rapida ayuda" para liberarse de la crisis, luego de informar del "derrumbe del gobierno" a eso de 10 - 13 de junio.
					
					Como dijo Truman, luego de informarse de esa noticia urgente, el gobierno de EE.UU. de aquel entonces "se vio obligado a apoyar a Syngman Rhee" y desencadenar lo mas pronto posible la guerra planeada para salvar al gobierno titere surcoreano.
					
					Por ultimo, EE.UU. recibio la informacion de que  pueblo chino intentaba liberar en el verano de 1950  a Taiwan.
					
					Segun la confesion de Mun Hak Bong, asesor de CIC y asesor politico de Syngman Rhee, luego de informarse de que el pueblo chino desplegara a mas tardar en julio la operacion de liberacion de Taiwan, EE.UU. decidio tomar medidas por anticipado, razon por la cual anticipo el dia de provocacion de guerra coreana. (Continua)
